name: The Great Gatsby
description: A classic novel by F. Scott Fitzgerald, exploring themes of wealth, love, and the American Dream.
George Orwell's dystopian novel about a totalitarian regime and the dangers of surveillance.

name: To Kill a Mockingbird
description: Harper Lee's tale of racial injustice and childhood innocence in the Deep South.

name: Pride and Prejudice
description: Jane Austen's romantic novel about manners, marriage, and social class.

name: The Alchemist
description: Paulo Coelho's philosophical novel about following your dreams and finding your personal legend.

name: The Catcher in the Rye
description: J.D. Salinger's story of teenage rebellion and self-discovery.

name: Moby Dick
description: Herman Melville's epic tale of obsession and revenge against the great white whale.

name: War and Peace
description: Leo Tolstoy's monumental novel of love, war, and the human spirit.

name: The Hobbit
description: J.R.R. Tolkien's fantasy adventure preceding The Lord of the Rings.

name: Frankenstein
description: Mary Shelley's gothic novel about the consequences of playing God.

name: The Sports Book
description: A comprehensive guide to the world of sports, from history to modern-day achievements.

name: The Art of War
description: An ancient Chinese military treatise by Sun Tzu, emphasizing strategic thinking and warfare.

name: A Journey Through Time
description: A science fiction novel that explores the concept of time travel and its implications.

name: The Love Letters
description: A collection of heartfelt love letters throughout history, capturing the essence of love.

name: The History of Cinema
description: An insightful history of the development of cinema, from its beginnings to the modern era.
